definition: the earth's natural satellite (see satellite sense 1a) that shines by the sun's reflected light, revolves about the earth from west to east in about 29¹/₂ days with reference to the sun or about 27¹/₃ days with reference to the stars, and has a diameter of 2160 miles (3475 kilometers), a mean distance from the earth of about 238,900 miles (384,400 kilometers), and a mass about one eightieth that of the earth
one complete moon cycle consisting of four phases (see phase entry 1 sense 1)
satellite sense 1, a natural satellite of a planet
an indefinite usually extended period of time

examples: keep out of the moon or it may turn your head

definition: something that resembles a moon: such as
a highly translucent (see translucent sense 1) spot on old porcelain
to spend in idle reverie : dream
to expose one's naked buttocks to
examples: One of the boys mooned the crowd.

definition: to spend time in idle reverie : behave abstractedly
